description:
Aino Vonge Corry - Teacher, Technical Conference Editor and Retrospectives Facilitator

ABSTRACT

As an expert you will be asked to facilitate the learning of others, not to mention your personal eternal learning in your field.

  • Dreyfus model of skill acquisition
  • Once you teach something you can become an expert.
  • Working memory
  • Long-term memory
  • SÃ¸ren Kierkegaard
  • Learning styles
  • Felder-Silverman model
    • Global vs. Sequential learners
    • Active vs. reflective learners
  • Design patterns and the memory model of the human brain.
  • Double bottleneck - a pattern for solving performance problems
  • Logos (know yoru stuff) - Pathos (be excited) - Ethos (who they think you are)
You cannot communciate with a large group of people but you can speak to them. In such case peer-learning, or learning in small groups can help them communicate with each other. Getting immediate and anonymous feedback can also help showing people they are not alone not understanding a subject and so they will dare to ask questions.
